channel.title: An Attempt for Redemption
channel.description:
[center][size=18pt][b]An Attempt for Redemption[/b][/size][/center]
Its been bothering me lately, the community I once knew back in 2009 is quickly diminishing (for those of you who will point this out, I forget my password on my old account when I moved houses.) I miss how MoparScape use to be the number one community, as soon as a new version of RuneScape was out we had a updated version of their cache stripped down and ready for users to use on their games in a matter of hours. Now all I see is the same server posted a million times with a different name and virus's running rampant threw download links. I want to be part of making Moparscape what it use to be, I know almost all of you miss this too (older members). Will anyone out there join me in a small battle to start to motivate the community to work again. We could have contests with prizes for the best server ideas, have more mods on staff to regulate posts and monitor download links and just have more fun with what were doing. Servers now are all for profit and almost always are run for a few weeks then shut down cause the person made enough money. I miss the good old days were servers were up for years, new quests came out weekly along with updates and everyone had fun. Please MoparScape, give us these times back.

item.title: An Attempt for Redemption
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

I wasn’t all that active in 2009 when I joined but was a hell of a lot better back then than now.

Read full topic

item.title: An Attempt for Redemption
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:1, topic:387352”][center][size=18pt]An Attempt for Redemption[/size][/center]

Its been bothering me lately, the community I once knew back in 2009 is quickly diminishing (for those of you who will point this out, I forget my password on my old account when I moved houses.) I miss how MoparScape use to be the number one community, as soon as a new version of RuneScape was out we had a updated version of their cache stripped down and ready for users to use on their games in a matter of hours. Now all I see is the same server posted a million times with a different name and virus’s running rampant threw download links. I want to be part of making Moparscape what it use to be, I know almost all of you miss this too (older members). Will anyone out there join me in a small battle to start to motivate the community to work again. We could have contests with prizes for the best server ideas, have more mods on staff to regulate posts and monitor download links and just have more fun with what were doing. Servers now are all for profit and almost always are run for a few weeks then shut down cause the person made enough money. I miss the good old days were servers were up for years, new quests came out weekly along with updates and everyone had fun. Please MoparScape, give us these times back.[/quote]

I’ll support you, of course.

I think there is a major problem as to the declining activity on moparscape.

Look at R-S and RL.

They have so many boards, ranging from graphics, to runescape showcases, to scripting, etc.

If we had those boards, it would increase the activity, in my opinion

Read full topic

item.title: An Attempt for Redemption
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I used to play a server called “RoonScape” (original ya?) which was on for a very long time. It had click training until you reach 70, thene you’d need to go PvP. Then there’s the manhole, which made it so you can get ecto token drops which can be exchanged for barrows. On a side note, he started off with a pimpscape source (at least I think so because of the dragon armour smithing) and went on to create something actually very good.

Read full topic

[/quote]

I don’t remember any servers with quests, other then minor miniquest from deltascape.[/quote]
I use to play a game called Sythix Scape that had new (really long and good) story quests that came out every monday :0

item.title: An Attempt for Redemption
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:34, topic:387352”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=483154.msg3539620#msg3539620 date=1300758951]

I don’t know much about Java coding, but I wish I did, and I want to learn. I want to make this community diverse so PI’s and Delta’s aren’t the only selection. I want to learn, but I can’t. I try to read tutorials, but they use terms that only people who already know how to code would understand. Basically, I need help to put it in Noob Friendly terms.

Unless you release a server with almost all the content done, you won’t get far… You might get support from older members for going out and creating something not made from WinterLove, but I doubt the newer members will bit. Good luck with creating a server in general. I suggest you use runewiki to learn some of the RS2 protocol too.

Though I probably will never make anything 100% programmed by me, I can still improve existing servers. It sounds like from most posts, that Delta’s and PI’s are poorly programmed in areas. Well, I’m trying to learn so I can fix that sort of issue.

I’d stay away from delta and PI in general. It’s been attempted so many times, your server will just be tossed to the side like the other thousand of them.

You have to start some were, I find Delta and PI are good examples of how to many tutorials and ripped code can make a fun server but it will be very poorly deigned, have bad stability, bad scalability, and just suck for developing, but it can also serve as a starting point to show how the RS2 protocol works and how not to design a server in most cases.
[/quote]

Project czar? allstar? dodian?
You can learn stuff from those, too.[/quote]

I know but I was just using your examples.

TimeBroken:

Allstars make me cry.

A good example of how years of shared code has made it nearly unusable…

Read full topic

I’d stay away from delta and PI in general. It’s been attempted so many times, your server will just be tossed to the side like the other thousand of them.

item.title: An Attempt for Redemption
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:1, topic:387352”][center][size=18pt]An Attempt for Redemption[/size][/center]

Its been bothering me lately, the community I once knew back in 2009 is quickly diminishing (for those of you who will point this out, I forget my password on my old account when I moved houses.) I miss how MoparScape use to be the number one community, as soon as a new version of RuneScape was out we had a updated version of their cache stripped down and ready for users to use on their games in a matter of hours. Now all I see is the same server posted a million times with a different name and virus’s running rampant threw download links. I want to be part of making Moparscape what it use to be, I know almost all of you miss this too (older members). Will anyone out there join me in a small battle to start to motivate the community to work again. We could have contests with prizes for the best server ideas, have more mods on staff to regulate posts and monitor download links and just have more fun with what were doing. Servers now are all for profit and almost always are run for a few weeks then shut down cause the person made enough money. I miss the good old days were servers were up for years, new quests came out weekly along with updates and everyone had fun. Please MoparScape, give us these times back.[/quote]

“Now all I see is the same server posted a million times with a different name and virus’s running rampant threw download links.” - This has always been the case… Nothing has changed since the opening of private servers, people download a source to run and make money… Though this is what private servers have become more of…

“have more mods on staff to regulate posts and monitor download links” - Moderators shouldn’t have to baby sit us, we should be able to take action our self by either reporting a the topic, telling someone on IRC, or contacting a moderator over PM, we shouldn’t have to depend on them to do everything by their self.

“We could have contests with prizes for the best server ideas” - This would be neat…

“I miss the good old days were servers were up for years, new quests came out weekly along with updates and everyone had fun.” - I know very few servers that are up for years and had new quests, updates, etc, etc come out every week…

Read full topic
